etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "person") + 民(民) (mín, "people") = collective term for a population or the citizens of a country -> the people
etymology.interpretation: 人民(人民) (rénmín, "the people") combines 人(人) (rén, "person") and 民(民) (mín, "people") to convey the idea of a collective group of individuals that form the population of a nation or society. It emphasizes the concept of unity among individuals as constituents of a community or country.

examples.chinese: 人民是国家的基石(人民是國家的基石)。
examples.english: The people are the cornerstone of the nation.

examples.chinese: 政府依靠人民(政府依靠人民)，共同创造繁荣(共同創造繁榮)。
examples.pinyin: zhèngfǔ yīkào rénmín, gòngtóng chuàngzào fánróng
examples.english: The government relies on the people, together creating prosperity.

examples.chinese: 革命属于人民(革命屬於人民)，人民实现了解放(人民實現了解放)。
examples.pinyin: gémìng shǔyú rénmín, rénmín shíxiàn le jiěfàng
examples.english: Revolution belongs to the people, and the people achieved liberation.
